did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes annual reports, proposals, correspondence, conference proceedings, subject files, and course material relating to Pinstrup-Andersen's career.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Per Pinstrup-Andersen is the H. E. Babcock Professor of Food, Nutrition and Public Policy, the J. Thomas Clark Professor of Entrepreneurship, and Professor of Applied Economics at Cornell University and a Danish economist and policy maker who won the 2001 World Food Prize for personally initiated the research effort which enabled several governments to reform their food subsidy programs and dramatically increase food availability to the severely impoverished. He has a B.S. from the Danish Agricultural University, a M.S. and Ph.D from Oklahoma State University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes annual reports, proposals, correspondence, conference proceedings, subject files, and course material relating to Pinstrup-Andersen's career.

did.unittitle: Annual Reports, Curricula Vitae, Correspondence, Awards, Conferences

"Food Policy for Developing Countries: The Role of Government in Global, National and Local Food Systems" - set of four DVDs (DVD #1447, 1761-1763), DVD of Pinstrup-Andersen's Publications (DVD #1448) and Publications by Pinstrup-Andersen in Spanish (paper format)
Publications by Pinstrup-Andersen in English and Danish and in Chronological Order
